channel.title: Webclient error- will pay!
channel.description:
alright so i have my client and when it loads i get a red x in the top corner then i look at the error and it gives me this...
Java Plug-in 1.6.0_24 Using JRE version 1.6.0_24-b07 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM User home directory = C:\Users\Aaron ---------------------------------------------------- c: clear console window f: finalize objects on finalization queue g: garbage collect h: display this help message l: dump classloader list m: print memory usage o: trigger logging q: hide console r: reload policy configuration s: dump system and deployment properties t: dump thread list v: dump thread stack x: clear classloader cache 0-5: set trace level to <n> ----------------------------------------------------
java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 168430090 in class file client at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 168430090 in class file client
any ideas on how to fix this?

item.title: Webclient error- will pay!
item.dc:creator: @samoankilla samoankilla
item.description:
@samoankilla wrote:

Its a basic cache error. Make sure all the paths are correct and that you have all your Sprites in your cache.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient error- will pay!
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Muroth:

Cannot find the class files in your jarred client

No.

Read this:
http://www.ninechime.com/forum/viewtopic.php?id=944

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient error- will pay!
item.dc:creator: @Mr.czar Mr.czar
item.description:
@Mr.czar wrote:

Did you jar the whole client even with cache in it? I think that’s why it’s saying. Take the cache out of the client folder and re make the jar file.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient error- will pay!
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Refer to my webclient error manual which can be found on this same board.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient error- will pay!
item.dc:creator: @pasta186 pasta186
item.description:
@pasta186 wrote:

This happened to me.To fix it,i simply made sure that it was properly linking to the jar file.E.G i was on webs.com and the file said client.jar.jar-All i had to do was change it to client.jar and TA-DA!Try that.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient error- will pay!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Muroth:

Cannot find the class files in your jarred client

Wrong. The first 4 bytes of any class file should be CA FE BA BE, but instead they are 0A 0A 0A 0A. So somewhere along the line, either you named a random file client.class or your compiler dun goofed.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient error- will pay!
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @JKOK JKOK
item.description:
@JKOK wrote:

can you copy+paste the client.java file in a code format in the post
(not the acuall file download)
because i can look see what is going on (ill look at it)

btw you dont have to pay ppl you know save your money

Read full topic
